sen.j: 小山 肆成（こやま しせい、文化 (元号)4年（1807年） - 文久2年9月6日 (旧暦)（1862年10月28日））は、江戸時代後期の医師。
sen.e: Shisei KOYAMA (1807 - October 28, 1862) was a doctor who lived in the late Edo period.

sen.e: He was born in 1807 to a jizamurai (high-ranking individual in a rural community) family in Hisagi Village, Muro County, Wakayama Prefecture (currently Hisagi, Shirahama Town, Nishi-Muro County, Wakayama Prefecture).

sen.e: Witnessing the outbreak of smallpox in the Kumano Region from 1838 to 1842, Shisei sold his family heirlooms such as swords to purchase cows to be used in his experiments.
